characters: TEN, NOTHING CAN STOP ROY THE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick’s ship flies through space.

dialogues.speaker: RICK 1
dialogues.text: Learning to fly this thing, Morty, is gonna be really liberating. INT. RICK’S SHIP - SPACE RICK, MORTY, and JERRY are flying through space. Jerry is the backseat. Rick is in the passenger seat.

dialogues.speaker: RICK 1A
dialogues.text: You know, y-y-you’re gonna be free to go on all kinds of errands for me.

dialogues.speaker: MORTY 2
dialogues.text: Cool.

dialogues.speaker: RICK 3
dialogues.text: See that planet right there? Don’t fly too close to that planet, someone will come out and try to wash your windshield. We hear an old Nokia-style ringtone of “Back That Azz Up.

dialogues.speaker: RICK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hold on. (answering phone, sketchy) Yeah. Yeah, I have it. Where do you want to meet? Alright, cool. He hangs up, excited.

dialogues.speaker: RICK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Alright, Morty, lesson’s over. We got some business to attend to a few light minutes south of here.

dialogues.speaker: JERRY 6
dialogues.text: Oh, you still use “south” in space. 6A Rick SCREAMS in shock.

dialogues.speaker: RICK 7
dialogues.text: Whoa, Jesus, Jerry, what the hell are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: JERRY 8
dialogues.text: What are you talking about, we agreed a boy’s father should be present when he’s learning to drive.

dialogues.speaker: RICK 9
dialogues.text: I guess I remember that. Wow, and you've just been back there this whole time? Amazing. (checks watch) Well we don’t have time to take him to Earth, Morty. W- head for 3924917.

dialogues.speaker: JERRY 10
dialogues.text: Cool, haha! Looks like I’m coming along for an adventure. RICK ll Yyyyep.-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick’s ship arrives at some empty stretch of space.

dialogues.speaker: MORTY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: This is where we're going?

dialogues.speaker: RICK, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Nope. An asteroid covered with the futuristic alien equivalent strip mall shimmers into existence and narrowly misses th as it soars by. Dumpy bus-looking spaceships and other cr soar away from it.

dialogues.speaker: RICK, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: This is. You can park in a handicap spot, Morty. Anything with less than eight limbs is considered disabled here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick, Jerry, and Morty enter this strip mall lobby that f like a low-budget animal hospital or car rental. Rick nod a REPTILIAN CLERK behind the counter, who slides a clipbo to him, which he starts filling out. HELEN, a large, motherly reptilian, approaches Jerry.

dialogues.speaker: 20A
dialogues.text: “MORTY-NIGHT RUN" FINAL ANIMATIC DRAFT (9/8/14) 3.

dialogues.speaker: HELEN 15
dialogues.text: Well, look at this fella! Aren’t you handsome.

dialogues.speaker: JERRY 16
dialogues.text: Thank you. I’m Jerry.

dialogues.speaker: HELEN 17
dialogues.text: Oh I know you are. Did you come here in a spaceship? She escorts him out of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jerry is flattered by the attention.

dialogues.speaker: JERRY 18
dialogues.text: I’m traveling with my son and father-in-law - w-wait, are they coming?

dialogues.speaker: HELEN 19
dialogues.text: Oh they’11 be back soon.

dialogues.speaker: JERRY 20
dialogues.text: What? She opens a door and ushers him through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jerry enters a room containing DOZENS OF JERRYS. Some are sleeping, most of them are walking around aimlessly sayin things like “excuse me” and “can I get some help here?”

dialogues.speaker: JERRY 21
dialogues.text: What the hell? ANOTHER JERRY standing nearby turns to our Jerry.

dialogues.speaker: ANOTHER JERRY 22
dialogues.text: (sharing his outrage) I know, right? YET ANOTHER JERRY is ushered into the room by another reptilian. That Jerry looks around.

dialogues.speaker: YET ANOTHER JERRY 23
dialogues.text: Oh, what the hell? Our Jerry looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: “MORTY-NIGHT RUN" FINAL ANIMATIC DRAFT (9/8/14) 4.

dialogues.speaker: JERRY 24
dialogues.text: I know, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick continues filling out the forms on the clipboard. Mo is looking at displayed literature for this place, which apparently called:

dialogues.speaker: MORTY 25
dialogues.text: “Jerryboree?” You created a daycare for my dad?

dialogues.speaker: RICK 26
dialogues.text: Are you kidding, I wish I had this idea. Well, I did have this idea, but I wish I was the version of me that owned it. That guy’s rich.

dialogues.speaker: REPTILIAN CLERK 27
dialogues.text: Don’t forget to check the reason for your drop off. We see the form Rick’s filling out includes options like “Earth under siege” and “threatened to tell Beth.” We catch another glimpse of the form Rick’s filling out, which contains an outline of a Jerry where you can indica existing physical Jerry damage. There’s two options for length of stay: “unknown” and “forever.”

dialogues.speaker: RICK 31
dialogues.text: Trust me, Morty, I’ve heard stories from other Ricks. Jerrys don’t tend to last five minutes off of Earth. Here they can romp and play with other Jerrys and this is a totally unregistered cross-temporal asteroid, he couldn't be safer. (hands Morty a scrap) Hey, Morty, hang on to this. That number is your Dad. If you lose it, we're not gonna be able to get him back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick’s ship soars in and nearly hits several better-looki spaceships while parking.  “MORTY-NIGHT RUN" FINAL ANIMATIC DRAFT (9/8/14)

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: Okay, wait here.

dialogues.speaker: MORTY
dialogues.text: I want to come with.

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: Don’t come with, it’s boring, it’s- (BURP) it’s business stuff.

dialogues.speaker: MORTY
dialogues.text: What kind of business do you do in a garage? You know this seems a little shady.

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: Right, yeah, like nothing shady ever happened in a fully furnished office? You ever hear about Wall Street, Morty? Y-y-y-you know what those guys do in a- in th- in their fancy board rooms? They take their balls and they dip them in cocaine and wipe them all over each other. You know, grandpa goes around and he does his business in public because grandpa isn’t shady. KROMBOPULOS MICHAEL, a tough-looking creature, appears at Rick’s window and taps on the glass.

dialogues.speaker: RICK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Ah, crap. (rolling down window) Hey, what’s up?

dialogues.speaker: KROMBOPULOS MICHAEL
dialogues.text: Hey, Rick! (holds up a bag) Haha, here you go, three thousand flerbos. Do you have the weapon?

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: (embarrassed) C-can we please - this is my grandson, Morty.

dialogues.speaker: KROMBOPULOS MICHAEL
dialogues.text: Well hi, Morty! I’m Krombopulos Michael, I’m an assassin, I buy guns from your grandpa! 32 33 34 35 36 37 38 39 40

dialogues.speaker: RICK 41
dialogues.text: Ugh. Unbelievable. (hands out a case) Here. Go away. Michael opens the case and brandishes a sinister looking gun.

dialogues.speaker: KROMBOPULOS MICHAEL 42
dialogues.text: Ooooh, yeah, this looks deadly. So this shoots anti-matter? My target can’t be killed with regular matter. Nice to meet you, Morty. (offers card) Listen, if you ever need anybody murdered please give me a call. I’m very discreet, I have no code of ethics, I will kill anyone anywhere. Children, animals, old people, it doesn’t matter. I just love killin’.

dialogues.speaker: RICK 45
dialogues.text: You're g- you’re giving him a card?! Morty takes Michael’s card. It’s a high-tech holographic displaying Michael’s smiling face, his dynamically update coordinates and, of course, “Krombopulos Michael, Killer. Michael walks away, leaving Morty and Rick in silence for beat.

dialogues.speaker: MORTY 46
dialogues.text: You sell weapons to killers? For money? The camera slowly pushes into Rick’s face as if Morty, an the audience, is about to learn the most epic truth revea in the show thus far.

dialogues.speaker: RICK 47
dialogues.text: Ugh, you’ve got what the intergalactic call a very planetary mindset, Morty. It’s more complicated out here, this isn’t “money,” these are flerbos. Do you understand what two humans can accomplish with three thousand of these?

dialogues.speaker: MORTY 48
dialogues.text: Uh, what?

dialogues.speaker: RICK 49
dialogues.text: An entire afternoon at BLIPS AND

dialogues.speaker: CHIIIIIIITZ
dialogues.text: We ZOOM INTO his happy mouth, and when we zoom out we’re

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An intergalactic arcade with all the coolest games and ea

dialogues.speaker: RICK 50
dialogues.text: Oh, this place is the best, it’s got beer, games, prizes, and you can never tell what time it is. They walk past a bank of gaming machines.

dialogues.speaker: MORTY 51
dialogues.text: You sold a gun to a murderer so you could play video games?

dialogues.speaker: RICK 52
dialogues.text: Yeah sure, I mean if you spend all day shuffling words around you can make anything sound bad, Morty. Here, check this out. Rick slaps a helmet from one of the machines onto Morty’s head and inserts a flerbo. Morty’s eyes roll back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 52A ROY, a twelve year old boy, wakes with a start. His M sitting on the edge of the bed.

dialogues.speaker: ROY 52B
dialogues.text: Ah!

dialogues.speaker: MOM 53
dialogues.text: Roy, what’s wrong?

dialogues.speaker: ROY 54
dialogues.text: I had a nightmare. I was with an old man. He put a helmet on me...

dialogues.speaker: MOM 55
dialogues.text: It’s just a fever. Get some sleep, I don’t want you missing school on Monday.

dialogues.speaker: 59A
dialogues.text: “MORTY-NIGHT RUN" FINAL ANIMATIC DRAFT (9/8/14) 8.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roy studies a textbook while we hear a TEACHER instructin

dialogues.speaker: TEACHER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I want you kids to look around you today and think about your future. Roy looks out the window at kids playing football.

dialogues.speaker: TEACHER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Now is the time in your life when anything is possible. We zoom in on the spiraling football. The football is cau by a twenty year old Roy as a stadium cheers. He runs.

dialogues.speaker: SPORTSCASTER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Spiraling perfectly it’s gonna be caught by Roy Parsons. Roy Parsons is at the twenty, now he’s at the

dialogues.speaker: ROCKET
dialogues.text: Roy catches the eye of RHONDA, a bookish girl in the crow They smile at each other. We dissolve on Rhonda’s face to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thirty year old Rhonda in a modest home addresses a thirt year old Roy across the dinner table as their eight year son picks at his food.

dialogues.speaker: RHONDA 59
dialogues.text: I just think it’s time to get realistic. Have you talked to my father about the carpet store? Roy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forty year old Roy takes inventory in a carpet store. He sighs. It’s a living. His phone rings. He looks at it. The caller ID reads “Doctor Schmidt.” INT. DOCTOR’S OFFICE - DAY DOCTOR SCHMIDT somberly explains test results to Roy.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR SCHMIDT 60
dialogues.text: Had we caught it sooner... well, hindsight is twenty twenty, Roy, what’s important is that we move quickly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A forty eight year old, emaciated Roy is in a hospital be Rhonda holds his hand.

dialogues.speaker: ROY 61
dialogues.text: I’m not ready to die.

dialogues.speaker: RHONDA 62
dialogues.text: You're not going to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 62A Roy is wheeled into his house. His family cheers from a table with a cake, under a banner that says “CANCER CAN STOP THE ROCKET.” It’s a jubilant scene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roy is fifty five now. He pleasantly shakes hands with a satisfied CUSTOMER.

dialogues.speaker: CUSTOMER 63
dialogues.text: Hey thanks for the carpet, Roy. Roy watches the customer go, then turns to look at his de There’s a trophy with a football on it that says “World’s Greatest Dad.” Roy smiles to himself.

dialogues.speaker: MANAGER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Hey Roy, you pull those Persian off- white shags for the clearance sale? 64A Roy goes to a step ladder and starts struggling with of carpet. He loses his balance, falls off the ladder and breaks his neck. His eyes roll back into his head.

dialogues.speaker: ROY 64AA
dialogues.text: Whoa, sh- shiiit! Agh. The words “GAME OVER” appear over his death in spooky fon

dialogues.speaker: 65A
dialogues.text: “MORTY-NIGHT RUN" FINAL ANIMATIC DRAFT (9/8/14) 10.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morty’s eyes roll back down and he rips the helmet off hi head in shock, looking around.

dialogues.speaker: MORTY 65
dialogues.text: Hoh, what the hell?! W-w-where am I? What in the hell?! Rick has been drinking his beer and watching the screen o Morty’s machine, which we now see is a game called “Roy: Life Well Lived.”

dialogues.speaker: RICK 66
dialogues.text: (examining screen) Fifty five years. Not bad, Morty. Y- you kind of wasted your thirties though with that whole “bird watching” phase.

dialogues.speaker: MORTY 67
dialogues.text: W-where- where’s my wife?

dialogues.speaker: RICK 68
dialogues.text: Morty, you were just playing a game. It’s called Roy. Snap out of it. Come on. Rick grabs tickets from the machine, hands them to Morty takes the helmet.

dialogues.speaker: MORTY 69
dialogues.text: (remembering) I’m Morty. You're Rick. (back to himself) Hey! You sold a gun to a guy that kills people!

dialogues.speaker: RICK 70
dialogues.text: Look at this... (re: screen) You beat cancer, and then you went back to work at the carpet store? Boo.

dialogues.speaker: MORTY 71
dialogues.text: D-don’t dodge the issue, Rick! Selling a gun to a hitman is the same as pulling the trigger!

dialogues.speaker: RICK 72
dialogues.text: It’s also the same as doing nothing. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: TIA
dialogues.text: “MORTY-NIGHT RUN" FINAL ANIMATIC DRAFT (9/8/14) 11.

dialogues.speaker: RICK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: If Krombopulos Michael wants someone dead, there’s not a lot anyone can do to stop him, that’s why he does it for a living. (putting on helmet) Now excuse me, it’s time to thrash your Roy score.

dialogues.speaker: MORTY 73
dialogues.text: You know, you could stop this killing from happening, Rick. You know, y-you did a bad thing selling that gun but you could undo it if you wanted.

dialogues.speaker: RICK 74
dialogues.text: (half concentrating) Uh huh. Yeah that’s the difference between you and me, Morty. I never go back to the carpet store. Rick fully concentrates on the game. A passing RANDOM ALI notices Rick’s skills.

dialogues.speaker: RANDOM ALIEN 75
dialogues.text: Holy shit, this guy’s taking Roy off the grid! (calling out) This guy doesn’t have a social security number for Roy! A small crowd gathers around the machine. Morty fumes for beat, then storms off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jerry, upset, talks to Helen at the front desk.

dialogues.speaker: JERRY 76
dialogues.text: Hi, I’m sorry, I think there was a misunderstanding. I’m an adult and would like to go home, please.

dialogues.speaker: HELEN 77
dialogues.text: Well of course, right through that tube. Jerry looks around annoyed, but still enters the tube.

dialogues.speaker: JERRY 78
dialogues.text: Unbelievable.

dialogues.speaker: HELEN 79
dialogues.text: You're doing great!

dialogues.speaker: JERRY 80
dialogues.text: (indignant) I know how to crawl in a tube. (crawling) Ah, come on. Uch, this is harder than it looks. (Jerry does not know how to crawl through a tube). As he through, we now see a huge room with tons of these tubes. Jerry keeps crawling and reaches a slide.

dialogues.speaker: JERRY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Whooooa! He curls around and then flies out into:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Other Jerrys are having fun in the ball pit. The ENTIRE R is decorated like a play version of Morty’s home.

dialogues.speaker: JERRY 82
dialogues.text: You guys are enjoying this? Don’t you feel a little patronized?

dialogues.speaker: OTHER JERRY 83
dialogues.text: How so? Just then an alien dressed in a large, PLUSHY BETH costum comes in.

dialogues.speaker: PLUSHY BETH 84
dialogues.text: Jeerrrrry!

dialogues.speaker: JERRY 85
dialogues.text: Oh come on, this is ridiculous.

dialogues.speaker: PLUSHY BETH 86
dialogues.text: I love you, Jerry!

dialogues.speaker: JERRY 87
dialogues.text: (melting) Awww, Beeeth!

dialogues.speaker: PLUSHY BETH 88
dialogues.text: Who wants to come watch Midnight Run with director’s commentary on?

dialogues.speaker: OTHER JERRYS 89
dialogues.text: Yeah! / Definitely! / Yes!

dialogues.speaker: 93G
dialogues.text: “MORTY-NIGHT RUN" FINAL ANIMATIC DRAFT (9/8/14) 13.

dialogues.speaker: PLUSHY BETH 92
dialogues.text: First one there gets to adjust the picture settings!

dialogues.speaker: JERRY 93
dialogues.text: (immediately turned) The factory tint setting is always too high! Out of my way! Jerry, now excited, chases Plushy Beth with all the other

dialogues.speaker: ANOTHER JERRY 93AA
dialogues.text: - tint setting is always too high!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jerry watches Midnight Run with Plushy Beth and tons of o Jerrys there, too. He rests his head on her shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Krombopulos Michael, geared up like a Navy Seal, goes thr a spiritual ritual. He takes a locket, wraps it ina handkerchief, and kisses it.

dialogues.speaker: KROMBOPULOS MICHAEL 93AA
dialogues.text: Oh boy, here I go killing again. As cool HEIST MUSIC plays...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - Krombopulos, with highly trained precision, crawls thro a vent, drops on a guard, and puts him in a sleeper hold. - Krombopulos hugs a wall, eyes two security cameras, ski by without them seeing, and sleeper holds a guard with hi feet. - Krombopulos monkey bars on pipes down in the sewer, cut hole out of a ceiling above him, a guy falls through. He catches him, sleeper holds him, then places him down gent - Through one final sequence, he takes an unconscious gua finger, places it on a scanner, the guard wakes up and he sleeper holds him again, then opens a secure door to:

dialogues.speaker: 94A
dialogues.text: “MORTY-NIGHT RUN" FINAL ANIMATIC DRAFT (9/8/14) 14.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KOOF (a glowing gaseous cloud of light) hovers in the cen of a small holding cell, the “bars” of which are rays of kind. Krombopulos enters and produces the sinister weapon Rick made. He levels it on the gaseous cloud. Rick’s ship smashes through the wall and into the room exactly where Michael was standing, obliterating Michael burying itself halfway into the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Krombopulos Michael’s business card is on the dashboard. the sounds of leaking steam and falling debris is the sou of the ship’s navigation system:

dialogues.speaker: NAVIGATION, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: You, have, arrived at... (splice) Krombopulos Michael. Your destination is below. Morty is slumped over the steering wheel of the craft, knocked out from the impact. He slowly regains consciousn

dialogues.speaker: MORTY 95
dialogues.text: (dazed) We're all out of off-white Persian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morty exits the vehicle, looking around. Among the debris finds Michael’s arm, still holding the gun.

dialogues.speaker: MORTY 96
dialogues.text: Aw, man. W-w-w-what have I done?

dialogues.speaker: GUARD 97
dialogues.text: Drop the gun! A guard with a laser rifle has the drop on Morty. Morty doesn’t know what to do.

dialogues.speaker: MORTY 98
dialogues.text: Y-you don’t understand. (points to Krombopulos) This guy was gonna kill someone.

dialogues.speaker: 105A
dialogues.text: “MORTY-NIGHT RUN" FINAL ANIMATIC DRAFT (9/8/14) 15.

dialogues.speaker: GUARD 99
dialogues.text: (raises his gun) I guess that makes two of us. Hurgh! A Rick portal appears in the middle of the guard’s body, splitting him down the center like a knife splitting a pi of fruit. The front of his body falls forward, the back f backward, leaving two even slices of guard on the floor a Rick steps through the portal onto the front half.

dialogues.speaker: RICK 100
dialogues.text: What are you doing, Morty? This is a Galactic Federation outpost! Look, I don’t have time to tell you my entire backstory but you need to understand that Grandpa and government don’t get along.

dialogues.speaker: KOOF 101
dialogues.text: He saved my life. Rick and Morty are startled that the imprisoned cloud is speaking.

dialogues.speaker: RICK 101B
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: MORTY 102
dialogues.text: Huh? Whoa! Are you Krombopulos Michael’s target? W-w-w-what’s your name?

dialogues.speaker: KOOF 103
dialogues.text: My kind has no use for names. I communicate through what you call Jessica’s feet. No. Telepathy.

dialogues.speaker: RICK 104
dialogues.text: Oh, good job, Morty. Y-y-you- you killed my best customer but you saved a mind-reading fart.

dialogues.speaker: KOOF 105
dialogues.text: I like this name, “Fart.” Morty, would you kindly release me by pulling that lever to the left of my cell? I am in great pain. Morty pulls the lever next to the cell, deactivating its laser bars. An ALARM sounds.

dialogues.speaker: MORTY 106
dialogues.text: Oh crap. Let’s get you out of here.

dialogues.speaker: RICK 107
dialogues.text: We can’t get him out of here. He’s gaseous, he’s not gonna make it through a portal, Morty.

dialogues.speaker: MORTY 108
dialogues.text: Well then I guess we’re all getting in the car. Right, uh...

dialogues.speaker: KOOF 109
dialogues.text: Fart.

dialogues.speaker: MORTY 110
dialogues.text: No! Just- j-j-just get in the car. Morty opens the door to Rick’s ship. Koof floats in.

dialogues.speaker: RICK 111
dialogues.text: Morty, come on. W- I wanna go back to Blips and Chitz. I don’t wanna deal with this.

dialogues.speaker: MORTY 112
dialogues.text: Rick, you've been clear on the fact that you don’t wanna help, so just go away.

dialogues.speaker: KOOF 113
dialogues.text: More are coming. Rick hears more guards coming.

dialogues.speaker: RICK 114
dialogues.text: Screw this. I’m out. 114A Rick goes back through a portal, which disappears. M stunned for a moment, then shakes it off and tries to sta the ship. He can’t.

dialogues.speaker: MORTY 114B
dialogues.text: Ohhh. Come on, come on! Several guards show up.

dialogues.speaker: GUARD 115
dialogues.text: Get out of the vehicle made of garbage or we will open fire!

dialogues.speaker: MORTY 116
dialogues.text: Um um um um. Morty keeps trying to start the ship.

dialogues.speaker: GUARD 119
dialogues.text: Open fire! A portal opens in the ceiling above them and a solid, six foot diameter torrent of sea water quickly fills up the r 119A Morty watches as the guards float around outside the ship, panicking. 119B Another portal opens in the floor beneath them and t quickly drains of water, taking all the guards with it as they’re being sucked down a drain. That portal closes before a third opens and Rick walks through. INT. RICK’S SHIP - CONTINUOUS 119¢ Rick climbs in, shoving Morty over.

dialogues.speaker: RICK 120
dialogues.text: Stupid ass fart saving carpet store motherfucker. Move. Rick tries the ship’s controls. RICK (CONT’D) 121 Wait, did you fuck with my seat settings? A long beat as Rick moves the seat forward and back as mo guards close in.

dialogues.speaker: KOOF 121A
dialogues.text: More are coming.

dialogues.speaker: MORTY 122
dialogues.text: Rick!

dialogues.speaker: RICK 123
dialogues.text: Yeah, yeah. With difficulty, the ship crushes the guards and exits through the hole whence it came or whatever Shakespeare w say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: “MORTY-NIGHT RUN" FINAL ANIMATIC DRAFT (9/8/14) 18.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We land on a particular business: Cogspot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morty, Rick, and Koof are in a cluttered mechanic’s garag GEARHEAD is working on Rick’s battered ship.

dialogues.speaker: GEARHEAD 127
dialogues.text: Your geldon converter is pretty dinged up.

dialogues.speaker: RICK 128
dialogues.text: That’s because my grandson drives like a male Obravadian. Yeah I said it. Some stereotypes are based in fact.

dialogues.speaker: GEARHEAD 129
dialogues.text: Actually it’s because of years of neglect. You really need to respect your gears, Rick. To you they’re just wheels with teeth, but in my culture, wars have been fought. Entire--

dialogues.speaker: RICK 130
dialogues.text: So I’ve heard. Just fix it. Rick walks over to Morty and Koof.

dialogues.speaker: RICK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I don’t think the Gromflamites can track us now but it looks like we're gonna be here for a while. (takes Morty aside) Or, you know, if you still have the gun K. Michael dropped we could finish the job and go home.

dialogues.speaker: KOOF 132
dialogues.text: You do understand I’m telepathic, right?

dialogues.speaker: RICK 133
dialogues.text: I’m being polite.

dialogues.speaker: MORTY
dialogues.text: Rick, we're taking him back where he belongs.

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: Oh yeah, where’s that? (BURP) Are you going on a quest to find He Who Smelt It?

dialogues.speaker: KOOF
dialogues.text: I came here accidentally through a wormhole located in what you call get out of my head, Fart, I know you're in here. Lalalala. No. In what you call the Promethean Nebula.

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: Oh great, just a hop skip and an eight hundred light year jump.

dialogues.speaker: MORTY
dialogues.text: You know you can leave any time you want, Rick. 138A Rick mutters and walks off.

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: Whatever you wanna do you little punk ass little bitch. I’m gonna go to Blips and Chitz.

dialogues.speaker: KOOF
dialogues.text: Thank you, Morty. You are not like other carbon-based life forms. You put the value of all life above your own.

dialogues.speaker: MORTY
dialogues.text: It’s how things should be. I-it’s how they could be.

dialogues.speaker: KOOF
dialogues.text: I could not agree more. (singing) The worlds can be one together... Morty gets a strange, entranced look on his face. Bowie-style tune begins. We enter:

dialogues.speaker: 138B
dialogues.text: 139 140 141 As a David Koof flies Morty through space in their shared imaginatio

dialogues.speaker: KOOF 142
dialogues.text: Cosmos without hatred. Stars like diamonds in your eyes. Morty flies through a cosmic void. Surreal images blur an transform into each other.

dialogues.speaker: KOOF, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The ground can be space (space Space space space), With feet marching towards a peaceful sky. All the moon men want things their way, But we make sure they see the sun. Goodbye, moon men. You say: Moon men wave goodbye.

dialogues.speaker: KOOF, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Goodbye, moon men. Morty and Koof float away from the moon men.

dialogues.speaker: KOOF, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Goodbye--

dialogues.speaker: RICK, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Shut the fuck up about moon men!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick is yelling at them while shaking a cane.

dialogues.speaker: RICK 147
dialogues.text: This isn’t a musical number, this is a fucking operation. We gotta be cool and fucking lay low. Morty looks embarrassed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 147A Jerry sits at a computer, GIGGLING. On screen: we se email subject: “FWD: FWD: FUNNY! MUSLIM & A DUCK GO GOLFI He clicks “FORWARD.” A Jerry next to him LAUGHS.

dialogues.speaker: ANOTHER JERRY 148
dialogues.text: Duck duck birdie! Very funny.

dialogues.speaker: RAM 202 "MORTY-NIGHT RUN" FINAL ANIMATIC DRAFT, (9/8/14)
dialogues.text: 148A PAN OUT to see a row of Jerrys at these computers, w some clicks, then GIGGLES. Jerry takes a sip of iced tea.

dialogues.speaker: JERRY 149
dialogues.text: Here comes another funny. He sends another email.

dialogues.speaker: OTHER JERRY 149A
dialogues.text: (laughs ) Oh this place is great.

dialogues.speaker: JERRY 149B
dialogues.text: I almost wish I could stay longer than one day.

dialogues.speaker: OTHER JERRY 150
dialogues.text: You just might.

dialogues.speaker: JERRY 151
dialogues.text: W-what do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Other Jerry leads Jerry into a wing of wounded, abandoned jaded Jerrys. One has a buzz cut, one wears a tank top, e

dialogues.speaker: OTHER JERRY 152
dialogues.text: These are the Jerrys whose Ricks and Mortys never came back. They live here now. 152A/B Our Jerry gets nervous. He shudders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick is watching Ball Fondlers on TV. A breaking news report comes in.

dialogues.speaker: GEAR NEWS PERSON 153
dialogues.text: No gear-turnings as of yet in the curious case of these unidentified humanoid fugitives, reportedly at large somewhere within the Gear System. Security camera images of Rick and Morty on the screen.

dialogues.speaker: RICK 154
dialogues.text: Son of a...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: “MORTY-NIGHT RUN" FINAL ANIMATIC DRAFT (9/8/14) 22. Rick storms up to Morty and Koof.

dialogues.speaker: RICK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Why were the Gromflamites holding you prisoner? What the fuck is so valuable about you?

dialogues.speaker: KOOF 156
dialogues.text: I am no more valuable than life itself. However I am able to alter the composition of atoms, like this: Koof's cloud pulses with electrical arcs and cycles throu various colors before dropping a lump of gold on the floo

dialogues.speaker: KOOF, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That was oxygen. I added seventy one protons to it.

dialogues.speaker: RICK 158
dialogues.text: Oh terrific. No wonder every cop in the system is looking for us. Any species that gets a hold of this thing is gonna use it to take over the galaxy. You know how inconvenient that’s gonna be to my work? A sound prompts Rick to go to a window. Government ships are hovering outside the garage.

dialogues.speaker: RICK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Somebody dropped the dime on us. (realizing) Gearhead. Rick turns to Gearhead, who is holding a gear gun on them

dialogues.speaker: GEARHEAD 160
dialogues.text: I’m sorry, Rick. The reward on your head is too high. And like you always say, you gotta look out for number one.

dialogues.speaker: RICK 161
dialogues.text: Number one is ME, asshole! You’re supposed to be my friend!

dialogues.speaker: GEARHEAD 162
dialogues.text: Friend? Do you even know my real name? It’s Revolio Clockberg Junior. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: 168A
dialogues.text: “MORTY-NIGHT RUN" FINAL ANIMATIC DRAFT (9/8/14) 23.

dialogues.speaker: GEARHEAD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I belong to an entire species of Gear People. Calling me Gearhead is like calling a Chinese person Asia Face. Rick spies an open box full of twigs. He grabs a handful throws them at Gearhead.

dialogues.speaker: GEARHEAD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: No! Not twigs! The twigs get stuck in the gears on Gearhead’s head, caus them to jam. Horrible sounds come from his interior. He d his gun and tries to get the twigs out. Rick runs up to Gearhead, grabs one of his arms and twist in a deliberate fashion. The small double hatch on Gearhead’s crotch slides open. reaches in through the hatch and pulls out two small gear Gearhead lets out a high pitched shriek. Rick grabs two o the gears on Gearhead’s mouth, pulls them off as well, th replaces them with the gears from Gearhead’s crotch. Gear makes horrible sounds and falls to his knees in shock.

dialogues.speaker: RICK 166
dialogues.text: Two things I want to make clear to everybody in this room: Never betray me and it’s time to go. Rick, Morty, and Koof jump in Rick’s ship. It takes off through a nearby window. Two GEAR COPS run in with weapons.

dialogues.speaker: GEAR COP 167
dialogues.text: Nobody move! Gearhead has gotten to his feet and stumbles over to the cops, making horrible muffled sounds, pointing at his fac

dialogues.speaker: GEAR COP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh my GOD! Are those-- Both gear cops start gagging. Maybe they puke but I don’t know what gear people vomit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick’s ship flies through a densely populated alley: vend peddle gear wares, an old gear woman wearing a babushka f the dust of a dirty gear out a window, children do playfu gear-related things.

dialogues.speaker: 170A
dialogues.text: “MORTY-NIGHT RUN" FINAL ANIMATIC DRAFT (9/8/14) 24. Two government motorcycle ships give pursuit and open fir them. Rick shoots one of the aliens off its motorcycle. The oth crashes into a parked gear car.

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: Hey, Morty, remember when you said selling a gun was as bad as pulling the trigger? How do you feel about all these people that are getting killed today because of your choices?

dialogues.speaker: MORTY
dialogues.text: I did the right thing, Rick!

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: Tell that to Gearhead’s gearsticles!

dialogues.speaker: MORTY
dialogues.text: You did that!

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: Wrong, I'd be playing Roy right now, at a certain point my hands are tied, Morty! 171 172 173 174 175 Rick and Morty take a hard right, where two more ships st chasing and shooting at them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jerry is with the Lost Jerrys, playing poker.

dialogues.speaker: JERRY
dialogues.text: I can’t believe Rick did this. This is the eighth to the last straw!

dialogues.speaker: GOATEE JERRY
dialogues.text: Ante up.

dialogues.speaker: JERRY
dialogues.text: Ya know what? Screw it. I have a better gamble for you guys. I say we escape.

dialogues.speaker: GOATEE JERRY
dialogues.text: If you want to leave you can just go out the front door. 176 177 178 181

dialogues.speaker: TANK TOP WEARING JERRY 182
dialogues.text: You think we’re kept here against our will? That would be illegal.

dialogues.speaker: JERRY 183
dialogues.text: But if you can leave, then why are you still here?

dialogues.speaker: SHAVED HEAD JERRY 184
dialogues.text: Same reason as you. We’re Jerrys. 184A Jerry is offended by that, and stands up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jerry marches past Helen.

dialogues.speaker: JERRY 185
dialogues.text: I'm leaving!

dialogues.speaker: HELEN 186
dialogues.text: Okay then! That was always allowed! INT. RICK’S SHIP - LATER Rick and Morty have three ships on their tail now. Rick puts on the brakes and the ships fly by. Rick shoots them and the ships crash. Now, WAY MORE people and bigger ships start pursuing them

dialogues.speaker: RICK 187
dialogues.text: Morty, take the wheel! Morty takes the wheel as Rick shoots at people.

dialogues.speaker: MORTY 188
dialogues.text: Whoa!! 188A Morty jerks the wheel and Rick falls over.

dialogues.speaker: RICK 189
dialogues.text: Whoa! Jeez dammit, Morty, who taught you to fly this thing? Hahaha I’m kidding I know that’s on me.

dialogues.speaker: MORTY 190
dialogues.text: Um, Rick? We see a HUGE ship has blocked them and they are surround

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: “MORTY-NIGHT RUN" FINAL ANIMATIC DRAFT (9/8/14) 26.

dialogues.speaker: RICK 191
dialogues.text: Shit. Well, I guess this is it.

dialogues.speaker: KOOF 192
dialogues.text: Morty, crack the window. Morty does so. Koof floats out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An alien cop is seated behind the flight stick of his squ craft. He doesn’t see Koof float into the back seat behin him.

dialogues.speaker: KOOF 193
dialogues.text: I wonder why Greg is always so critical of my girlfriend?

dialogues.speaker: ALIEN COP, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (shrug) Well, he’d probably like to have me to himself, that’s how friends are.

dialogues.speaker: KOOF 195
dialogues.text: Or does he want her to himself. The cop gets a weird look on his face. Koof surrounds him

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A gear man is having sex with a gear woman. The cop and K watch from the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: KOOF 195A
dialogues.text: (singing) The worlds can be one together. Cosmos without hatred. Stars like diamonds in your eyes.

dialogues.speaker: ALIEN COP 195B
dialogues.text: My life is a fucking joke. He steers his ship into one of the larger ships, causing both to explode.

dialogues.speaker: KOOF 195C
dialogues.text: (singing) Goodbye, moon men. You say goodbye, moon men. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: “MORTY-NIGHT RUN" FINAL ANIMATIC DRAFT (9/8/14) 27.

dialogues.speaker: KOOF, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Goodbye, moon men. Oh goodbye. Those explosions cause a chain reaction of others, sendin smaller craft spiraling into nearby buildings, which collapse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After all of it is done, Koof floats back in through Mort window.

dialogues.speaker: KOOF 197
dialogues.text: Alright, let's proceed.

dialogues.speaker: RICK 198
dialogues.text: Damn. Can’t blame that on the dog. Talk about silent but deadly! I’m- I-I’ve seen some nerve gas but that- that g- this gas got NERVE. Haha, you know what I’m sayin’?

dialogues.speaker: MORTY 199
dialogues.text: Are you done?

dialogues.speaker: RICK 200
dialogues.text: I‘1l let you know, Morty. Gone with the Wind, am I right? If you don’t like that one, Morty, an alt on that could be, like, if I said “Gasablanca.” All right, I’m done. Let’s get to the Promethean Nebula so my grandson can finish saving a life!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jerry wanders, timidly, into a busy interstellar mass tra station. He goes up to a booth.

dialogues.speaker: ALIEN BOOTH OPERATOR 201
dialogues.text: Glagga blag blag?

dialogues.speaker: JERRY 202
dialogues.text: Um... Earth, please? She stamps something and hands it to him.

dialogues.speaker: JERRY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Is this-- Do I pay?

dialogues.speaker: ALIEN BOOTH OPERATOR 204
dialogues.text: Agga blag blag blag!

dialogues.speaker: ALIEN TRAVELERS IN LINE 205
dialogues.text: Agga blag! / Wagga baag! / Ag blag!

dialogues.speaker: JERRY 206
dialogues.text: I'm sorry! Sorry! Jerry, scared, runs out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jerry exits and walks by a creepy homeless octopus and a feral stray alien animal.

dialogues.speaker: JERRY 206AA
dialogues.text: Hey. Its face expands out and it screams. Jerry runs away. He walks down an alley and runs into an alien.

dialogues.speaker: ALIEN 206B
dialogues.text: Gagga blag blag. Agga blag. Agga blag.

dialogues.speaker: JERRY 207
dialogues.text: Oh, uh... hey, what? I don’t- Uh, what do you want?

dialogues.speaker: ALIEN 208
dialogues.text: Agga blag bla-- The alien explodes, covering Jerry in green goop. Two smaller aliens approach Jerry and fill cups with the goop. He runs away. They each take a drink. Jerry sees a giant horrifying alien and runs away from it

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jerry sits on an alien bus stop, trying to look confident the sights and sounds of the alien city whiz by all aroun him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jerry comes through the entrance, looking at the floor as heads through the double doors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: “MORTY-NIGHT RUN" FINAL ANIMATIC DRAFT (9/8/14) 29.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Lost Jerrys are working on an entertainment center. J skulks up, ashamed.

dialogues.speaker: TANK TOP WEARING JERRY
dialogues.text: Hey, are you the one that left? Jerry nods. TANK TOP WEARING JERRY (CONT’D) I get it, it’s a- it’s a hassle out there.

dialogues.speaker: JERRY
dialogues.text: Right? I mean, who needs that?

dialogues.speaker: GOATEE JERRY
dialogues.text: Right? I mean, who needs that? PAUL FLEISCHMAN, a Jewy man in his early 40s approaches.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL FLEISCHMAN
dialogues.text: Hahoh, not us.

dialogues.speaker: JERRY
dialogues.text: Uh, who are you?

dialogues.speaker: PAUL FLEISCHMAN
dialogues.text: Oh. Excuse me. (extends hand) Paul Fleischman. Infinite timelines. In some of them Beth re- marries.

dialogues.speaker: JERRY
dialogues.text: Jeez.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL FLEISCHMAN
dialogues.text: Don’t worry, I treat Beth very well and I do not overstep my bounds with Morty. Every kid needs a dad but there’s no replacing you. Hey, you wanna give us a hand with this? We're trying to figure out how to get the sound coming through the stereo instead of the TV. I- I- I don’t- it’s very difficult.

dialogues.speaker: JERRY
dialogues.text: Oh, uh, well is there an AUX input? 212 213 214

dialogues.speaker: GOATEE JERRY 221
dialogues.text: We tried that, but there’s two different colors... We PULL BACK on row upon row of entertainment centers as packs of Jerrys occupy themselves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A dinosaur eats something, then moves on, revealing a run down interstellar rest stop, with a few alien families picnicking. Rick’s ship pulls in. INT. RICK’S SHIP - CONTINUOUS Rick, Koof, and Morty.

dialogues.speaker: KOOF 222
dialogues.text: The wormhole is seventy of what you call meters what you call north of what you call here.

dialogues.speaker: RICK 223
dialogues.text: Fine, Morty, take your fart to his hole and say your goodbyes. I’m gonna find some fuel and take a biiig fat Morty. That’s my new word for shit because of today’s events.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morty walks through the brush with Koof floating next to They come to a small clearing with a wormhole in the cent

dialogues.speaker: KOOF 224
dialogues.text: Here it is. This should take me back to my kind.

dialogues.speaker: MORTY 225
dialogues.text: I’m gonna miss you... Um. Fart. I-I- I’m really sorry your name became Fart.

dialogues.speaker: KOOF 226
dialogues.text: I will be back soon, Morty.

dialogues.speaker: MORTY 227
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: “MORTY-NIGHT RUN"

dialogues.speaker: KOOF
dialogues.text: After I return to the others with this location, we will be back for your cleansing.

dialogues.speaker: MORTY
dialogues.text: Um. Cleansing?

dialogues.speaker: KOOF
dialogues.text: Carbon-based life is a threat to all higher life. To us, you are what you would call a disease. Wherever we discover you, we cure it. You said yourself that life must be protected, even through sacrifice. You haven’t changed your mind about that, I can sense your thoughts. Morty? Morty nods, frustrated but resigned.

dialogues.speaker: MORTY
dialogues.text: Um. Before you go... could you sing a- c-could you sing for me again?

dialogues.speaker: KOOF
dialogues.text: Yes, Morty. (singing) Cosmos without hatred...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Koof flies with Morty through space paradise again.

dialogues.speaker: KOOF
dialogues.text: (singing) Diamond stars of cosmic light, Quasars shine through endless night And everything is one in the beauty And now we say goodbye-- Koof’s song is cut off by a beam of anti-matter ripping through him, leaving a sizzling hole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REVEAL: Morty is holding Krombopulos’ gun in his tremblin

dialogues.speaker: KOOF
dialogues.text: (dying) Ahhh. Ohh, noooo. Ohhh. Ahh. FINAL ANIMATIC DRAFT (9/8/14) 31. 228 229 230 231 232 233 234

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: “MORTY-NIGHT RUN" FINAL ANIMATIC DRAFT (9/8/14) 32. Morty shoots Koof until all of his cloud is consumed with sizzling, widening holes that finally turn him into nothi Morty drops the weapon, a tear runs down his cheek.

dialogues.speaker: MORTY
dialogues.text: Goodbye. EXT. PREHISTORIC PLANET - RICK’S SHIP - LATER Morty walks over to Rick at the ship. Rick is putting strange looking rocks into a hatch on the rear of the

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: So did you guys make out a little bit? Is he gonna send you a postcard? Morty doesn’t say anything, just gets in the ship.

dialogues.speaker: RICK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Man, that guy hit the lottery when he crossed paths with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick’s ship flies through space.

dialogues.speaker: RICK, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Morty, I know I picked on your core beliefs and decision making a lot today - INT. RICK’S SHIP - CONTINUOUS Rick is flying with Morty, who is silent.

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: - but I am glad that you insisted on getting that fart home. You know, at- at least all the death and destruction wasn’t for nothing, ya know? Morty stares ahead, silent.

dialogues.speaker: RICK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You miss your fart friend, huh? Well, I’ve got a little surprise for you, buddy. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 235 some car. 238 239

dialogues.speaker: RICK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: While you were gone, I found a new wormhole, with millions of beings just like him on the other side, and they're all coming to visit!

dialogues.speaker: MORTY 242
dialogues.text: (alarmed) What?! Rick, no, you can’t!

dialogues.speaker: RICK 243
dialogues.text: It’s too late, Morty. The hole’s opening.

dialogues.speaker: MORTY 243BA
dialogues.text: No no, Rick, you don’t understand! 243A Rick leans, makes a face, then FARTS and settles bac smirking. Morty stares at him, then looks out the window.

dialogues.speaker: RICK 244
dialogues.text: (pause) There’s- there’s a lot more where that came from, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bunch of Rick’s ships park outside Jerryboree.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 244A It’s like the end of summer camp as Ricks and Mortys to pick up their eager Jerrys. Our Rick and Morty show up

dialogues.speaker: RICK 245
dialogues.text: (to another Rick) Hey, hey bro. How many people was your Morty responsible for killing today?

dialogues.speaker: OTHER RICK 246
dialogues.text: None, we chilled at Blips and Chitz all day ain’t that right, homie?

dialogues.speaker: OTHER MORTY 247
dialogues.text: Darn right, bro. Roy rules! 247A The Other Rick and Other Morty LAUGH, they had a GRE

dialogues.speaker: RICK 248
dialogues.text: Must be nice. Morty doesn’t say anything. Helen brings over Jerry.

dialogues.speaker: 249A
dialogues.text: “MORTY-NIGHT RUN" FINAL ANIMATIC DRAFT (9/8/14)

dialogues.speaker: RICK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hey, Morty, there’s our Jerry. Jerry nods and hugs Morty, relieved to be going home.

dialogues.speaker: JERRY
dialogues.text: I missed you. Hey, Rick.

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: Glad you’re safe, Jerry. Whaddaya say we go home?

dialogues.speaker: JERRY
dialogues.text: I'd like that. They share a nice moment. As they walk out, ANOTHER RICK walks up to Rick, showing his ticket.

dialogues.speaker: ANOTHER RICK
dialogues.text: Hey wait, uh, do you have 5126?

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: Uh, I’m not sure. Morty? Morty pulls out his ticket to show.

dialogues.speaker: ANOTHER RICK
dialogues.text: Uh, that’s a Blips and Chitz ticket.

dialogues.speaker: MORTY
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: Way to go, Morty. Eh, whatever. 249 250 251 252 253 254 255 256 257 The Ricks lazily swap their Jerrys as the Jerrys look at another in fear.

dialogues.speaker: JERRY
dialogues.text: (simultaneously) Uuuuum, w-wait what?

dialogues.speaker: ANOTHER JERRY
dialogues.text: (simultaneously) Uuuuuuuuuuh... w-wait what?

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: (simultaneously) Alright, come on, Jerry.

dialogues.speaker: ANOTHER RICK
dialogues.text: (simultaneously) Come on, Jerry. 258 259 260 261

dialogues.speaker: RAM 202 "MORTY-NIGHT RUN" FINAL ANIMATIC DRAFT, (9/8/14)
dialogues.text: They walk off. Do they have the right Jerry? Does it matt

dialogues.speaker: 266A
dialogues.text: “MORTY-NIGHT RUN" FINAL ANIMATIC DRAFT (9/8/14) 36.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tons of aliens go about their day as we hear an ALARM. A voice that sounds like an emergency P.A. speaks to the ci

dialogues.speaker: COMMERCIAL VOICE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Emergency. Emergency. We are under an invasion... OF FUN! Everyone who has stopped starts stampeding, as we see ali bust through doors:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It’s bustling. We see groups of aliens playing all types weird games, cheers’ing with Blips & Chitz monikered mugs

dialogues.speaker: COMMERCIAL VOICE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: There’s been an abduction of prices. With all new deals! Forty five flerbos for chog-huks and nachos. ALL DAY. Six Risk Tag! Queege! Unlimited Pop-A-Shot. Aliens play a Pop-A-Shot.

dialogues.speaker: COMMERCIAL VOICE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: And there’s only one place where you can play: “Roy 2.” We see the row of Roy games as people come out stoked.

dialogues.speaker: COMMERCIAL VOICE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: At Blips and Chitz. Rick is in the crowd chugging a beer. ZOOMS IN ON:

dialogues.speaker: RICK 267
dialogues.text: It’s the coolest place in the world! Hahaha I- I get to be in the commercial! A graphic stamps: “Blips and Chitz” on screen. Underneath reads: “We got the Blips, if you got the Chitz.”
